response.overview: Carlos Zárate (39-0, 38 KOs) challenged WBC bantamweight champion Rodolfo Martínez (42-3-1, 35 KOs) on May 8, 1976 at Inglewood's Forum. The matchup pitted Zárate's devastating power against Martínez's championship experience, with both Mexican fighters known for knockouts.  Zárate entered riding a 16-fight KO streak, having dominated contenders like James Martinez and Joe Guevara. Martínez had made three title defenses since dethroning Rafael Herrera in 1974, including tough battles against Venice Borkhorsor and Alberto Sandoval.  The fight represented a generational clash - the 25-year-old Zárate's first title shot against the veteran champion. With Zárate's explosive offense facing Martínez's proven durability, the Forum crowd anticipated a classic Mexican power struggle. The bout would determine whether Zárate's dominance could translate to world championship level.
response.title: Rodolfo Martinez vs. Carlos Zarate
